FAQ

  1. What is this project?
  2. Why have these?

  5. What is the CLI package?
What is this project?

This is a set of various extremely useful bits of code that have evolved over several projects at the NCSA's CSD.

(National Center for Supercomputing Applications, Cybersecurity Directorate).

They are widely used in projects such as OA4MP, CILogon and QDL.

[top]

Why have these?
Mostly these are specialized and do common operations that may be much more complex in other packages. For instance, the crypto module has X 509 certificate and key utilities that use native Java, so you don't have to import some huge stack of code to do them.

[top]

What is the configurations package?
This is a set of tools that allows you to parse XML configurations and turn them into a runtime environment. It supports aliases, includes (so can import other configurations) multiple inheritence and several other nice features.

[top]

What is the Store package?
The store package models a persistent map with a unique key. It has implementations for in-memory, file system and SQL (various vendors are supported). This therefore implements a very common construct in programming.

[top]

What is the CLI package?
CLI - Command Line Interface. This is a set of tools that lets you create command line interfaces to darned near anything.

[top]
